verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH8010>, when Solomon had finished<WH3615> the building<WH1129> of the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, and all Solomon<WH8010>'s desire<WH2837> which he was pleased<WH2654> to do<WH6213>,

And as for thee<WH3212>, if thou wilt walk before<WH6440> me<WH1732>, as David thy father<WH1> walked<WH1980>, in integrity<WH8537> of heart<WH3824>, and in uprightness<WH3476>, to do<WH6213> according to all that I have commanded<WH6680> thee<WH8104>, and wilt keep my statutes<WH2706> and mine ordinances<WH4941>;

then I will establish<WH6965> the throne<WH3678> of thy kingdom<WH4467> over Israel<WH3478> for ever<WH5769>, according as I promised<WH1696> to David<WH1732> thy father<WH1>, saying<WH559>, There shall not fail<WH3772> thee a man<WH376> upon the throne<WH3678> of Israel<WH3478>.

But if ye shall<WH7725> turn<WH7725> away from following<WH310> me<WH1121>, ye or your children, and not keep<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687> and my statutes<WH2708> which I have set<WH5414> before<WH6440> you<WH1980>, but shall go and serve<WH5647> other<WH312> gods<WH430>, and worship them<WH7812>;

And though this house<WH1004> is so high<WH5945>, yet shall every one that passeth<WH5674> by it be astonished<WH8074>, and shall hiss<WH8319>; and they shall say<WH559>, Why hath Jehovah<WH3068> done<WH6213> thus unto this land<WH776>, and to this house<WH1004>?

and they shall answer<WH559>, Because they forsook<WH5800> Jehovah<WH3068> their God<WH430>, who brought forth<WH3318> their fathers<WH1> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and laid hold<WH2388> on other<WH312> gods<WH430>, and worshipped<WH7812> them<WH5647>, and served them<WH3068>: therefore hath Jehovah brought<WH935> all this evil upon them<WH7451>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7097> of twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141>, wherein Solomon<WH8010> had built<WH1129> the two<WH8147> houses<WH1004>, the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068> and the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>

(now Hiram<WH2438> the king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> had furnished<WH5375> Solomon<WH8010> with cedar<WH730> - trees<WH6086> and fir<WH1265> - trees<WH6086>, and with gold<WH2091>, according to all his desire<WH2656>), that then<WH227> king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> gave<WH5414> Hiram<WH2438> twenty<WH6242> cities<WH5892> in the land<WH776> of Galilee<WH1551>.
And Hiram<WH2438> came out<WH3318> from Tyre<WH6865> to see<WH7200> the cities<WH5892> which Solomon<WH8010> had given<WH5414> him<WH3474>; and they pleased him not.
And he said<WH559>, What cities<WH5892> are these which thou hast given<WH5414> me<WH251>, my brother? And he called<WH7121> them the land<WH776> of Cabul<WH3521> unto this day<WH3117>.
And Hiram<WH2438> sent<WH7971> to the king<WH4428> sixscore<WH3967> talents<WH3603> of gold<WH2091>.

And this is the reason<WH1697> of the levy<WH4522> which king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> raised<WH5927>, to build<WH1129> the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and his own house<WH1004>, and Millo<WH4407>, and the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and Hazor<WH2674>, and Megiddo<WH4023>, and Gezer<WH1507>.

Pharaoh <WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> had gone up<WH5927>, and taken<WH3920> Gezer<WH1507>, and burnt<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>, and slain<WH2026> the Canaanites<WH3669> that dwelt<WH3427> in the city<WH5892>, and given<WH5414> it for a portion<WH7964> unto his daughter<WH1323>, Solomon<WH8010>'s wife<WH802>.
And Solomon<WH8010> built<WH1129> Gezer<WH1507>, and Beth-horon<WH1032> the nether<WH8481>,
and Baalath<WH1191>, and Tamar<WH8412> in the wilderness<WH4057>, in the land<WH776>,

and all the store<WH4543> - cities<WH5892> that Solomon<WH8010> had<WH5892>, and the cities for his chariots<WH7393>, and the cities<WH5892> for his horsemen<WH6571>, and that<WH2837> which Solomon<WH8010> desired<WH2836> to build<WH1129> for his pleasure in Jerusalem<WH3389>, and in Lebanon<WH3844>, and in all the land<WH776> of his dominion<WH4475>.

their children<WH1121> that were left<WH3498> after<WH310> them in the land<WH776>, whom the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> were not able<WH3201> utterly to destroy<WH2763>, of them did Solomon<WH8010> raise<WH5927> a levy<WH4522> of bondservants<WH5647> unto this day<WH3117>.

But of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did Solomon<WH8010> make<WH5414> no bondservants<WH5650>; but they were the men<WH582> of war<WH4421>, and his servants<WH5650>, and his princes<WH8269>, and his captains<WH7991>, and rulers<WH8269> of his chariots<WH7393> and of his horsemen<WH6571>.

But Pharaoh<WH6547>'s daughter<WH1323> came up<WH5927> out of the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> unto her house<WH1004> which Solomon had built<WH1129> for her<WH1129>: then did he build Millo<WH4407>.

And three<WH7969> times<WH6471> a year<WH8141> did Solomon<WH8010> offer<WH5927> burnt-offerings<WH5930> and peace-offerings<WH8002> upon the altar<WH4196> which he built<WH1129> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, burning incense<WH6999> therewith<WH4196>, upon the altar that was before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>. So he finished<WH7999> the house<WH1004>.

And king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> made<WH6213> a navy of ships<WH590> in Ezion-geber<WH6100>, which is beside Eloth<WH359>, on the shore<WH8193> of the Red<WH5488> Sea<WH3220>, in the land<WH776> of Edom<WH123>.
And Hiram<WH2438> sent<WH7971> in the navy<WH590> his servants<WH5650>, shipmen<WH582> that had knowledge<WH3045> of the sea<WH3220>, with the servants<WH5650> of Solomon<WH8010>.
